com.meti.io.connect

Class ConnectionListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.meti.io.connect.ConnectionListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ConnectionListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

    A ConnectionListener is created by a Peer to search for incoming Connections. If an ExecutorService is specified in the constructor, then it is used to create threads. Make sure listen() is declared for the ConnectionListener to function.

    Since:
    1/2/2018
    Version:
    0.0.0
    Author:
    SirMathhman

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionListener

        public ConnectionListener(int port,
                          Peer parent)
                   throws java.io.IOException

        Constructs a ConnectionListener from a port and a parent Peer. Calls ConnectionListener(int, Peer, ExecutorService) with a null ExecutorService.

        Parameters:
        port - The port.
        parent - The parent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an Exception occurred when constructing this object.

      • ConnectionListener

        public ConnectionListener(int port,
                          Peer parent,
                          java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService service)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a ConnectionListener from a port, parent Peer, and an ExecutorService. The parent is required because that is the least complex way of invoking the ConnectionHandler inside of parent.
        Parameters:
        port - The port.
        parent - The peer.
        service - The service.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an Exception occured when hosting on the port.

      • initConnectionClass

        public void initConnectionClass(java.lang.Class<?> connectionClass)
        Sets and initializes the subclass of Connection to be instantiated of. Searches for a constructor which only takes in a Source object. Connection.Connection(Source)
        Parameters:
        connectionClass - The subclass.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no constructors with Source could be found.
        See Also:
        Source, Connection

      • listen

        public void listen()
        Listeners for peers on the specified port. Creates a new Thread for listening, or on the ExecutorService if specified.

      • getServerSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket getServerSocket()
        Returns the internal ServerSocket used by the ConnectionListener.
        Returns:
        The ServerSocket.
